issue.title: [#8] Add Kafka receiver to CLI.
issue.body:
This PR adds a receiver to the CLI that consumes telemetry data and events from Kafka. Please refer to "Start the Downstream Consumer" in https://github.com/eclipse/hono/pull/2216#issuecomment-730255279 for usage instructions.

This belongs to #8.

issue.title: Add transport protocol agnostic interface for northbound Hono-Client
issue.body:
This adds an interface for clients to be used by northbound applications, which removes the dependency from AMQP-specific types and allows to easily switch between AMQP-based and Kafka-based messaging.
This currently only supports downstream messaging. Support for command & control is to be added later.
This is the first step of #2392. Implementations of this interface are subject of subsequent pull requests to keep this PR smaller.

body: I would like to use the consumer from #2420 for the implementation of the Kafka-based northbound client. This is very little code then for telemetry and events.

issue.title: [#2392] Implementation of the Kafka-based northbound Client
issue.body: This PR belongs to #2392. It adds the implementation of the Kafka-Based northbound application client.

body: PR #2432 offers a Kafka-based implementation of the protocol-agnostic northbound interfaces.

@sophokles73 What about the AMQP-based implementation? Strangling the _hono-cllient_ module is FMPOV best left with you. 
FMPOV, resolving the old "client" module best left in your hands. However, I could provide (as an intermediate step) an implementation that "wraps" the `org.eclipse.hono.client.application.ApplicationClientFactory` and provides it with the new interface `org.eclipse.hono.client.application.ApplicationClientFactory`. Does that make sense?
@b-abel yes, you can leave the Proton based implementation to me.
